reviewText: Linkin Park - Live in Texas is a solid and thrilling live concert of one of my favorite bands. The audio cd is good but the the DVD concert is worth the purchase alone. Chester Bennington's vocals are spot-on and jeez I don't know how he can sing, scream, and belt for two hours straight! He's an amazing frontman, and Mike Shioda never skips a beat with his rapping styles, I was really impressed. The band have a lot of staying-power as well. Every song this band plays sounds good and refreshing. I highly recommend this incredible concert!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This dvd/cd combo is great and all lp fans should own this. It was what i thought it was going to be and theres nothing special about it. There are like 18 live performances on the dvd which is great BUUUUT there is nothing more no interviews or anything which sucks but its soo great to see 50000+ fans singing along that it makes up for it! On the cd is a mix of 12 of lp's hits from both of there cd's also One Step CLoser has an additional special concert part that kicks a$$ this is such a great combo. BUY IT!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I like to purchase DVD's of live concerts of bands that I think I might go see live.  If their live performance is up to snuff when compared to the band's CD release with studio enhanced audio, I will seek out concert dates.If the live footage/audio quality on the DVD is the same as studio cd, then I will go see them in concert and know I will get my monies worth.Have you ever had this happen to you:Sometimes a band's CD sounds awesome and you are hyped to go see them live, but when you see them live they stink up the place. (Trapt) You have to leave!If you have not seen LP in concert,then this concert footage should hold you over until then.

reviewText: Their first full live album and they don't fail. I was a little disappointed on not hearing Breaking The Habit live. Linkin Park is probably one of the better live bands now, songs like Pushing Me Away are so professionely done in sound and vocal work. Crawling does seem lackluster if anyone has heard Crawling before live but it is good. One Step Closer of course ends it and overall, a definite must have for linkin park fans.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Linkin Park is one of the best bands now, and definitely one of the best live bands ever, they're the only band that i've heard in while that sounds like they are giving 100% at every show, most bands on tour, get really tired, and they start to slow down on stage at the end of the tour, Linkin Park might be the same but they don't show it. Great DvdI subtracted a star from this because i didn't like the Cd, because i was expecting all 18 songs on the Cd, because if you can't watch the whole dvd at some time, whats better then to listen to it in your car or on a school bus. So the cd is a little lacking but the Dvd has great power and is a great dvd from LP.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: HE WHO FUNKS BEHIND THE ROWS!!
reviewText: This CD/DVD set of "Linkin Park Live In Texas" is simplyan amazing performance!It's just like being right there at one of their concerts!Everything on here is slammin' to me and I've turned many people onwho were somewhat aprehensive or at least old fuddy-duddies in their attitudeswhere this late 90's / early 2000's alternative rock / hip-hop fusion band were concerned.Some people who are from previous generations of rock and other genres of music have amental block for anything released after say, 1985, considering it to be absolute garbage!I'm glad that I'm an exception to that rule...I think Linkin Park is a great modern band!This is a great musical buy and one you'll find yourself watching andlistening to over and over! This was Linkin Park at or near their creative peak IMHO!!If there's anything negative to say about this DVD it's that there are no special featureslike behind the scenes stuff or a song or two that didn't make it into the final cut!Other than that, it's perfect! (-:
summary: This Is An Amazing Concert DVD!!----Linkin Park Are In Top Form In This!!

reviewText: The DVD and CD are both awesome.  I have a home theater and it sounds like Linkin Park is live in my house. I have watched the DVD about 4 times and it rocks.  I can't stop listening to the CD in my car.  If you think you may like LP, you will love this DVD/CD. You won't be disappointed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The good:Linkin Park is an awesome live act. Tight, energetic, strong vocals, a real layered sound achieved instrumentally and with Mr Hahn's manual scratching, keyboards and occasional loop. The sound on the DVD and CD sounds great to me. I'm not an expert at spoting overdubs, but I didn't hear anything suspicious. I also like that you get both a DVD and a CD in a reasonably priced package.The bad:The video was edited for teenagers. I felt like I was watching MTV cribs or something. Ridiculous. The cuts were so fast and jerky, it was hard to get a fix on anything. As a drummer, I like to check out the drummer and see what he's doing. It was just about worthless in that regard. The occasional drum shots lasted about a second. Of course I would like a multiple angle feature, which it didn't have on any songs.So, I can't give the video 5 stars, but would recommend it to anyone who likes live hard rock.

reviewText: Linkin Park is terrible but I have to admit that this concert had a lot of energy and that's why I gave it 2 stars. The funny thing about this world is so many retarded people go to Linkin Park concerts (I know, I was there for some some reason). Their guitar riffs aren't as repetative (same songs, different chords) but they are still pretty retarded if they think they can get away with such crappy drumming, bass playing and singing. Rapping was not as bad as I thought it would be, maybe they changed the songs a little before the concert. Don't buy this unless you really like sausage links, err.. I mean Linkin Park (in which case you're retarded). See ya.
summary: Lots of energy, still hate the band though
Title: N/A

reviewText: I always really liked Linkin Park, but this DVD was life-altering in my musical world.  I had just turned 42 years old when this came out and I'm a single mom of a teenager.  I have been into punk/alternative music since the early 1980's and my musical tastes have evolved with the genre up to and including now.  I'm not your typical Linkin Park fan.  It's funny when they refer to their fans as "the kids" because I'm clearly not "a kid" (though a kid at heart) and the two concerts I've seen since this DVD came out had lots of people my age, and not just parents bringing their kids (and since I was a parent bringing my kid-I'm really the bigger fan, though he also loves LP--I wonder how many other "parents" were like me, that is, attending the concert because they love LP too).But about this DVD in particular.  I saw a preview of the DVD at the theatre the evening before it was released.  I was absolutely BLOWN AWAY.  I simply could not believe how good they are.  I had purchased all three of their previous CDs as each was released, but I guess I never paid that close of attention to their music.  So I purchased the CD/DVD the next day as it was released.  I also pulled out all three of their other CDs from my CD collection and put them in my car with Live in Texas.  That was about a year ago.  I have listened to Linkin Park almost non-stop ever since.I honestly believe that Linkin Park is one of the best bands of all time.  The concept behind their music is so novel in comparison to other alternative bands.  Now some people say, well they sound like so-and-so, but it is the other bands that are copying LP, not the other way around (if you compare the chronologies of their CD releases, you will see what I mean).  A lot of people that give Amazon reviews rank songs in their CDs, but I find that impossible to do.  While there are one or two songs I don't like as much as the others (and I'm talking 1 or 2 out of ALL their songs, not per album), ALL of their songs are really great!If you like Linkin Park, but have never seriously listened to their music, I highly recommend this CD/DVD.  Watch the DVD without distractions and you will see what a truly GREAT band they are.
summary: Life-altering DVD for this alternative fan

reviewText: It took them 4 years, but it's finally here. Nothing defines a band more than their live performance, and fans of Linkin Park will not be disappointed. The CD/DVD combo is nice, as live performances are better watched than just listened to. Linkin Park is just as intense live with their music. The energy level is high, and it is maintained throughout the performance. Those who are not LP fans may even want to check this one out. It's an awesome value.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw LP in Philadelphia during the Summer Sanitarium tour and was very impressed. I am a long time Metallica fan(saw them in 1983 in a bar in Brooklyn)and let's just same I am the same age as the guys in Metallica. My oldest daughter listens to LP and I was really impressed with them. The concert footage, sound, and concert on the DVD are awesome. However, why the hell would LP produce a widescreen letterbox non-anamorphic transfer? I mean if you go widescreen make it an anamorphic transfer for 16X9 TVs, that has been an industry standard for the past couple of years. If you are not going to make an anamorphic transfer then go 4X3 Pan and Scan. It suprises that a band that is so technical in their music and sound would let something like this happen. The guys in Slayer knew to make War at Warfield anamorphic widescreen. HDTV 16X9 TV owners will be disappointed in this product as I am. I have deducted two stars for this video transfer mistake that LP made!
summary: Concert Rocks! DVD non-Anamorphic Widescreen Sucks!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Again, another 5 stars to a beautiful DVD!  Not only do you get an Awesome DVD here, but you get a 'BONUS' CD, to go along with the DVD.  The coverage is amazing, along with a great set list.  Here you get Linkin Park playing in front of an enormous crowd at 'Reliant Stadium in Houston Texas on The Summer Sanitarium Tour'.  You can tell it was hot, but the crowd was Totally into this concert (Especially, when Chester tells the crowd, their going to be on this DVD).  You will also see one of the largest Mosh Pits Ever!  On the DVD, you get the following songsIn This Order:1) Don't Stay2) Somewhere I Belong3) Lying From You4) Papercut5) Points Of Authority6) Runaway7) Faint8) From The Inside9) Figure.0910) With You11) By Myself12) P5hng Me A*wy13) Numb14) Crawling15) In The End16) A Place For My Head17) One Step CloserAnd on the CD, you get the following track list:1) Somewhere I Belong2) Lying From You3) Papercut4) Points Of Authority5) Runaway6) Faint7) From The Inside8) P5hng Me A*wy9) Numb10) Crawling11) In The End12) One Step CloserA must own for anyone who has any taste at all!  Even if you don't like Linkin Park (Only the Insane Freaks of society, wouldn't like Linkin Park), you should still purchase this DVD.  If you are still reading this review, and you haven't clicked on the 'Purchase ASAP Button', there is something wrong with you.  Now stop reading this review and buy yourself a couple hundred copies of this DVD (Great gifts for anyone, even your Grandma should own a copy of this DVD, Mine Does)!Crawling in my skin, these wounds they will not heal.  Fear is how I fall, confusing what is real.  There's something inside me, that pulls beneath the surface.  Consuming/Confusing this lack of self-control, I fear is never ending.Yo, Yo, forfeit the game, before somebody else takes you out of the frame.  Puts your name to shame, cover up your face.  You can't run the race, the pace is too fast.  You just won't last!It's going down!  The rhythm projects 'round the next sound reflects the complex hybrid dialect now.  Detects the mesh of many elements compressed down.  The melting pot of a super-futuresque style.  The combination of vocal caress, with lungs the gasp for breath.  From emotional stress, with special effects and a distorted collage.  carefully lodged between beats of rhythmic barrage.
